repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem: float preview window still exist when back at origianl.

Solution: if selected is -1 mean back to origianl close preview window first.

comment_data.body: What is the point of this wait right before `screen:expect()`?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1717,22 +1718,89 @@ describe('builtin popupmenu', function()
                 sum_scroll_delta = 0,
               },
             },
-          }
+            win_viewport_margins = {
+              [2] = {
+                bottom = 0,
+                left = 0,
+                right = 0,
+                top = 0,
+                win = 1000,
+              },
+              [4] = {
+                bottom = 0,
+                left = 0,
+                right = 0,
+                top = 0,
+                win = 1001,
+              },
+            },
+          })
         else
-          screen:expect {
+          screen:expect({
             grid = [[
-            o^                                       |
-            {n:one            1info}{1:                    }|
-            {1:~              }{n:     }{1:                    }|
-            {1:~                                       }|*7
-            {2:-- }{8:Back at original}                     |
-          ]],
-          }
+              on^                                      |
+              {s:one            }{n:1info}{1:                    }|
+              {1:~              }{n:     }{1:                    }|
+              {1:~                                       }|*7
+              {2:-- }{5:match 1 of 3}                         |
+            ]],
+          })
+        end
+
+        -- when back to original the preview float should be closed.
+        feed('<C-P>')
+        if multigrid then
+          screen:expect({
+            grid = [[
+            ## grid 1
+              [2:----------------------------------------]|*10
+              [3:----------------------------------------]|
+            ## grid 2
+              on^                                      |
+              {1:~                                       }|*9
+            ## grid 3
+              {2:-- }{8:Back at original}                     |
+            ## grid 5
+              {n:one            }|
+            ]],
+            float_pos = {
+              [5] = { -1, 'NW', 2, 1, 0, false, 100 },
+            },
+            win_viewport = {
+              [2] = {
+                win = 1000,
+                topline = 0,
+                botline = 2,
+                curline = 0,
+                curcol = 2,
+                linecount = 1,
+                sum_scroll_delta = 0,
+              },
+            },
+            win_viewport_margins = {
+              [2] = {
+                bottom = 0,
+                left = 0,
+                right = 0,
+                top = 0,
+                win = 1000,
+              },
+            },
+          })
+        else
+          screen:expect({
+            grid = [[
+              on^                                      |
+              {n:one            }{1:                         }|
+              {1:~                                       }|*8
+              {2:-- }{8:Back at original}                     |
+            ]],
+          })
         end
 
         -- test nvim__complete_set_info
-        feed('<ESC>cc<C-X><C-O><C-N><C-N>')
-        vim.uv.sleep(10)
+        feed('<ESC>S<C-X><C-O><C-N><C-N>')
+        exec_lua([[vim.wait(100)]])

comment_data.body: because when first select item 3 it doesn't have info so the preview window will close, but CompleteChanged callback is set info of 3. so wait this callback. there is test for this info set from event callback  so use vim.wait here.

comment_data.body: I don't understand how that requires you to use `vim.wait()`. The test runs fine even if you remove this line.

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

title: fix(float): close preview float window when no selected
